channel.title: Fudge Messaging JIRA
channel.description: An XML representation of a search request

item.title: [PRO-48] Dates are deserialized as LocalDates leading to class cast exception
item.description:
XML encoded dates are deserialized as LocalDates but are expected to be FudgeDates. This leads to a class cast exception when encoding as a binary message.

Example xml:

<ResetDate type="date">2014-01-16</Activ_ResetDate>
               <ClosingBidDate type="date">2014-01-15</Market_ClosingBidDate>

Example head of stack for class cast:

java.lang.ClassCastException: org.threeten.bp.LocalDate cannot be cast to org.fudgemsg.types.FudgeDate
	at org.fudgemsg.wire.types.DateWireType.writeValue(DateWireType.java:58)
	at org.fudgemsg.wire.FudgeDataOutputStreamWriter.writeFieldValue(FudgeDataOutputStreamWriter.java:277)
	at org.fudgemsg.wire.FudgeDataOutputStreamWriter.writeField(FudgeDataOutputStreamWriter.java:192)
item.summary: Dates are deserialized as LocalDates leading to class cast exception

comments.comment: fixed in 0.3.9.17

item.title: [PRO-47] FudgeJSONStreamReader truncates messages after the first submessage
item.description: The logic in hasNext() is broken. It returns false when the current element is SUBMESSAGE_FIELD_END without checking whether any of the objects on the stack have more elements.
item.summary: FudgeJSONStreamReader truncates messages after the first submessage

item.title: [PRO-46] XML reader and writer can't handle dates with time zones
item.description: Datetimes are written to XML using toString() which includes a 'Z' suffix for UTC ZonedDateTime instances. When datetimes are read from XML the LocalDateTime.parse() method is used which can't handle the zone suffix and throws an exception.
item.summary: XML reader and writer can't handle dates with time zones

item.title: [PRO-45] Allow auto-generated header to be controlled
item.description: The auto-generated header should be controllable to better handle Checkstyle in Java
item.summary: Allow auto-generated header to be controlled

item.title: [PRO-44] Refactor project to support maven
item.description:
Refactor project to support maven.

Change directory structure and add pom.
item.summary: Refactor project to support maven

comments.comment: Fixed on OpenGamma fork

item.title: [PRO-43] Create S4 wrappers to interrogate Fudge message based objects from R
item.description: We don't currently have a full Fudge/R implementation, relying on read-only access through Fudge-C. This should at a minimum allow full inspection of objects.
item.summary: Create S4 wrappers to interrogate Fudge message based objects from R

item.title: [PRO-42] Create Python class/object wrappers
item.description: Possible implementations to target include jamesc/Fudge-Python and vrai/Fudge-PyC
item.summary: Create Python class/object wrappers

item.title: [PRO-41] Use the builder pattern instead of to/from Fudge messages in generated code
item.description: This is consistent with how developers have been working with non-autogenerated Fudge messages in Java.
item.summary: Use the builder pattern instead of to/from Fudge messages in generated code

item.title: [PRO-40] JavaClassCode.useCopyConstructor logic flawed
item.description:
If a class and its superclasses are proto defined without mutable fields, the reference is used as-is instead of a copy taken. This is flawed if a subclass instance is mutable. An alternative is to always call the .clone method on assignment, but implement clone() to return "this" in the case of an immutable message (which currently lacks a clone method).

If the code for "useCopyConstructor" remains after tackling this, rename it to something that better matches the test it makes.
item.summary: JavaClassCode.useCopyConstructor logic flawed

item.title: [PRO-39] Abstract class with extern message in subclass fails to compile
item.description:
Abstract class with extern message in subclass fails to compile.

The abstract class has a method based on FudgeMsgFactory whereas the subclass uses FudgeSerializationContext.

public abstract org.fudgemsg.FudgeMsg toFudgeMsg (final org.fudgemsg.FudgeMsgFactory fudgeContext);
  public org.fudgemsg.FudgeMsg toFudgeMsg (final org.fudgemsg.mapping.FudgeSerializationContext fudgeContext) {
abstract message Base {
  }
  message Concrete extends Base {
    required readonly ZonedDateTime periodEnd;
  }
  extern typedef ZonedDateTime = ZonedDateTimeMsg;
  extern message ZonedDateTimeMsg;
item.summary: Abstract class with extern message in subclass fails to compile

comments.comment: All proto files are now generated using a serialization or deserialization context. This behaviour can be turned off from the command line using -XtoFromWithContext=false

item.title: [PRO-38] A deep copy function for C structures could be useful
item.summary: A deep copy function for C structures could be useful

comments.comment:
E.g. the generated code could include a function like:

FudgeStatus <message>_copy (const struct <message> *src, struct <message> **dest);

item.title: [PRO-37] Use size_t instead of int in generated code where appropriate
item.description: The incorrect use of int in place of size_t for holding lengths generates compiler warnings in 64-bit environments where size_t is longer than int.
item.summary: Use size_t instead of int in generated code where appropriate

item.title: [PRO-36] Use of Object in a Fudge-Proto file results in improper serialization of Double values
item.description:
If I have a message definition with a field:
Object value;

and in the generated Java class I set the value to a Double, rather than detecting that this is actually a double and thus can be handled by Fudge primitive encoding, the encoding system will encode the Double as a JavaBean and pull in all the fields (e.g. NaN, infinite, value, ...).

It should consider for all the primitive classes that are natively handled by Fudge (String, Long, Double, ...) that it can just include those as-is.
item.summary: Use of Object in a Fudge-Proto file results in improper serialization of Double values

comments.comment: TODO change generated code to use the combined objectToFudgeMsg & addClassHeaders function from the FSC which will do this.

item.title: [PRO-35] Use ???Provider interfaces more appropriately
item.description:
The generated code currently has attributes which are ???Provider. These should be the target types, returned by the accessors, with the mutators taking a provider and calling .to? on it. E.g.

private LocalDateTime _foo;

public LocalDateTime getFoo () {
return _foo;
}

public void setFoo (DateTimeProvider foo) {
_foo = LocalDateTime.of (foo);
}
item.summary: Use ???Provider interfaces more appropriately

comments.comment: The getResolve call in equals and hashcode will then be redundant.
This won't work, as a Fudge datetime can be a LocalDateTime or an OffsetDateTime.

item.title: [PRO-34] "noextern" codegen
item.description: This can be implemented within the core to affect any language binding. Any extern message or type becomes the reduced type rather than a binding specific type. I.e. all external messages reduce to the anonymous message type and any external types treated as the primitive Fudge type.
item.summary: "noextern" codegen

item.title: [PRO-33] Allow "extern type" as well as "extern message"
item.description:
Extern message is okay for some hand crafted messages - it indicates that there will be a field with that name that is a sub-message and the reader of a .proto file would need to refer to documentation elsewhere for format details. There are cases when we want to express external types that reduce to primary fudge types.

E.g. I want to write something like:

message Foo {
Currency currency;
}

Where Currency might have some useful meaning within a language binding but in conceptual essence is just a string. Rather than declare Currency to be completely external I then also want to write:

type Currency = string;
or
extern type Currency = string;

The first form would introduce the Currency symbol in a similar way to a C typedef making the currency field of Foo a string. If a language binding supports it the second form would additionally drop references to the referenced type in code output but reduce it through the dictionary to the correct underlying type.
item.summary: Allow "extern type" as well as "extern message"

item.title: [PRO-32] Anonymous message fields generate redundant functions
item.description:
E.g.
message Foo { optional message bar; }

generates Foo_setBar (FudgeMsg, FudgeMsg) and Foo_setFudgeMsgBar (FudgeMsg, FudgeMsg). We only need the first one.
Same applies to the 'get' functions.
item.summary: Anonymous message fields generate redundant functions

item.title: [PRO-31] Ability to define default value for boolean field in fudge proto file
item.description: Current version is setting the boolean field to 1/0 rather than setting it to true/false when creating the object
item.summary: Ability to define default value for boolean field in fudge proto file

item.title: [PRO-30] Use an iterate and switch on field ordinal pattern for fromFudgeMsg
item.description: The current code generated is not very efficient for large messages, especially if the underlying implementation is O for a field search by name or ordinal.
item.summary: Use an iterate and switch on field ordinal pattern for fromFudgeMsg

item.title: [PRO-29] Generate FudgeString constants instead of the _Key and _Class #defines
item.description: _Key constants are used to add fields to or extract them from fudge messages and would rarely be needed as platform native strings. It would be more efficient to do the conversion at compile time rather than at each request. _Class constants are used in a similar fashion.
item.summary: Generate FudgeString constants instead of the _Key and _Class #defines

item.title: [PRO-28] String encoded enum functions should use FudgeString instead of platform string type
item.description: Using the platform string type adds quite a lot of overhead in converting UTF-8 to/from platform strings. The encoded UTF-8 values can be generated at compile time.
item.summary: String encoded enum functions should use FudgeString instead of platform string type

item.title: [PRO-27] Generated Java comments containing \u are interpreted by javac as the start of a unicode escape sequence
item.description: Causes "illegal unicode escape" compiler error
item.summary: Generated Java comments containing \u are interpreted by javac as the start of a unicode escape sequence

item.title: [PRO-26] Non-required lists that aren't provided result in a NullPointerException on load
item.description:
Given a .proto file like:
message Foo { repeated Bar bars; }

This operation will fail:
(new Foo()).getBars();

The .getBars() returns a Collections.unmodifiableList(_bars), which doesn't support a null parameter.

The JAXB standard for this type of thing is to always set a _bars variable so that it's never null, and then have things like .setBars() either overwrite the instance, or just change the contents based on the provided parameter (which is my preference).
item.summary: Non-required lists that aren't provided result in a NullPointerException on load

item.title: [PRO-25] Generated Java code should include Clover directives
item.description:
If you use Clover for your code coverage, it will automatically instrument generated Java files. This isn't ideal, though, as generated code in general shouldn't be tested.

You can control this by wrapping the generated Java files with
///CLOVER:ON
///CLOVER:OFF
as per the documentation: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CLOVER/Using+Source+Directives

We should wrap all generated Java files with these blocks.
item.summary: Generated Java code should include Clover directives

comments.comment: The tools allow arbitrary text fragments to be prepended/appended to generated files.

item.title: [PRO-24] External definition class different to proto namespace identifier
item.description:
An external reference currently just adds an entry to the symbol tables. It should be possible to add a different underlying identifier for code generation to that entered into the proto symbol table on a per-language basis. E.g.:

extern message Object {
binding Java { identifies "java.lang.Object"; }
binding "C#" { identifies "System.Object"; }
}
item.summary: External definition class different to proto namespace identifier

item.title: [PRO-23] Registration callback to deserialisationcontext in generated code
item.description: Will be needed so that proto code matches the serialisation framework spec when mutable fields are external objects, or a cyclic reference to an outer message object.
item.summary: Registration callback to deserialisationcontext in generated code

item.title: [PRO-22] Nulls in array based fields can cause NullPointerException during deep copy or constraint checks
item.description: Arrays containing one or more null elements can cause NullPointerException from the code generated by "writeDefensiveCopy" in mutators, copy constructors, and fudge message decoders.
item.summary: Nulls in array based fields can cause NullPointerException during deep copy or constraint checks

item.title: [PRO-21] fudge-proto Ant task should print out what it's generating
item.description: Right now it operates silently, but it should output the files that it's generating and what .proto file was used as the source.
item.summary: fudge-proto Ant task should print out what it's generating

item.title: [PRO-20] Reduce size of generated code
item.description: Some of the generated code is fairly repetitive (e.g. the fromFudgeMsg inheritance check). A helper class with some static methods in the main Fudge package might make the output smaller.
item.summary: Reduce size of generated code

item.title: [PRO-19] Optionally create .gitignore file with generated classes
item.description:
We should optionally create a .gitignore file in the directory in which we create files indicating that they're generated and should be ignored, only if there isn't already a .gitignore there.

If they say to generate a .gitignore, and there's already a .gitignore, we should emit a compile warning.
item.summary: Optionally create .gitignore file with generated classes

comments.comment: Use -XgitIgnore at command line, or gitIgnore="true" in the Ant task

item.title: [PRO-18] Serialization not storing base class for linking to hierarchies
item.description:
• Message1 has a repeated element that refers to Message2
  • Message3 and Message4 are extensions of Message2
  • Serialize an instance of Message1 that contains Message3 and Message4
  • There's no type information that would allow you to restore Message3 and Message4

The fields themselves are present in the sub-message, but not the metadata about what the actual type of the sub-messages are.
item.summary: Serialization not storing base class for linking to hierarchies

comments.comment: Class names now added by toFudgeMsg when the instance is a sub-class. Class details are otherwise omitted to save space. fromFudgeMsg detects and invokes correct class if needed.

item.title: [PRO-17] Control for singular/plural names
item.description:
If I have a repeated element, I'd like to be able to control the code name separately from the field name.

So for example, I have a set of things which I call "foo". I want to refer to the collection as "foos" but I want each field in the resulting message to be named "foo" (as "foo" is a single one, building up to a list, which I prefer to call "foos").

This is effectively AI-complete, so it should be up to the developer to write this in the .proto file.
item.summary: Control for singular/plural names

item.title: [PRO-16] Need to error with multiple declarations of the same message
item.description: In one Proto compilation run, if I have two messages with the same name in the same namespace, it should fail as a compilation error.
item.summary: Need to error with multiple declarations of the same message

comments.comment: Have added a unit test to confirm the compiler detects duplicate message identifiers. Cannot reproduce the original error.

item.title: [PRO-15] Need a way to add documentation to the .proto files and have it flow to generated code
item.description: We need some way to be able to put in documentation in the .proto files (at message and field level) and have that flow through to language-specific documentation (such as Javadoc for Java) in the generated files.
item.summary: Need a way to add documentation to the .proto files and have it flow to generated code

item.title: [PRO-14] Generation in Java produces un-read field
item.description:
This bit of Proto Fudge:
message Configuration {

}
message SubConfiguration extends Configuration {

string paramOne;
string paramTwo;

binding Java { methods "toString"; }
}

will result in the following block in the Builder in the resultant Java class:
public static class Builder {
private final com.opengamma.engine.function.config.Configuration _fudgeRoot;
private String _definitionClassName;
private String _invokerClassName;
public Builder () { _fudgeRoot = null; }
protected Builder (final org.fudgemsg.FudgeFieldContainer fudgeMsg) {
_fudgeRoot = com.opengamma.engine.function.config.Configuration.fromFudgeMsg (fudgeMsg);

However, in this case, the _fudgeRoot is never read, resulting in a build warning.

This might be because the super-message is effectively empty. If so, we should just always put in a @SuppressWarnings("unused") on the _fudgeRoot declaration.
item.summary: Generation in Java produces un-read field

item.title: [PRO-13] Generated classes don't have setters for individual fields
item.description: I should have getters and setters for everything, though I can easily see that it should be an option to make classes final/immutable. But by default the generated objects should be mutable, or else it's too difficult to construct them in the first place.
item.summary: Generated classes don't have setters for individual fields

comments.comment: Fields are now mutable by default, with a readonly modifier available. Command line or Ant task options can be used to override this default.

item.title: [PRO-12] Generated files don't have sufficient generation metadata
item.description: In the header, they should have a timestamp of when they were generated, and on what machine and by whom.
item.summary: Generated files don't have sufficient generation metadata

comments.comment: Not worth doing this before PRO-3

item.title: [PRO-11] No way to have a mutable repeated element
item.description: If I have a repeated element that isn't required, I have no way to actually mutate the element on the generated class. I get the same method list as in PRO-10, and the list is immutable, and I don't have a default constructor.
item.summary: No way to have a mutable repeated element

comments.comment: (see PRO-13) unless given the "mutable" modifier, no methods to set the repeated element will have been generated. This is now the default behaviour.

item.title: [PRO-10] Names of methods for required repeated elements are a little odd
item.description:
At the moment, if I have a field like
repeated required Foo foos;

I end up with several methods:

  • getFoos() <-- Returns the FIRST element in the list, or IndexOutOfBoundsException
  • getFoos(int n) <-- Returns the Nth element in the list
  • getFoosList() <-- Returns an unmodifiable version of the list

It seems to me that all we actually need is:

  • getFoos() <-- Returns an unmodifiable version of the list

From there I can access the others quite easily, and it's far more sensible.
item.summary: Names of methods for required repeated elements are a little odd

comments.comment: Creates a single getX method for repeated fields that returns an unmodifiable list.

item.title: [PRO-9] Class-level documentation for generated classes should include message definition
item.description: Much like JAXB will include at least a part of the XSD fragment that was used to generate a class, the Fudge Proto generator should do the same thing for generated classes and the message definition.
item.summary: Class-level documentation for generated classes should include message definition

comments.comment: This should probably be done after (or during) PRO-3

item.title: [PRO-8] Generated .equals() should have an instance equality check first
item.description:
Right now we're just generating a field-by-field comparison, but we should have a
if(this == o) return true;
at the beginning as it's the most common case.
item.summary: Generated .equals() should have an instance equality check first

comments.comment: If-statement added to generated equals code.

item.title: [PRO-7] Eclipse plugin
item.description: Extend the org.eclipse.ui.editors point with a TextEditor that supports basic syntax coloring for the .proto message keywords and comments. Create a "compile" action (salvage the code from the AntTask), and/or an onchange listener using the Compiler.Context notifications to identify error positions within the source code.
item.summary: Eclipse plugin

comments.comment: Is there a .proto plugin for GPB that we could leverage here?

item.title: [PRO-6] Default toFudgeMsg() and fromFudgeMsg() methods
item.description:
Fudge-Proto should always generate a version of

toFudgeMsg()
fromFudgeMsg()

without a context argument.

The default behaviour of these methods should be to use the default context (no object builders or any other customisations).

This default behaviour is the most important use case. However, to extend on the idea, it should be possible to customise the behaviour of these methods via the .proto file or maybe a .properties file. Think of log4j's Logger.getLogger() method and how that reads an external .properties file to customise the logger.
item.summary: Default toFudgeMsg() and fromFudgeMsg() methods

comments.comment: I'm not sure about this. I think people need to be more aware of the FudgeContext, and people should probably if they're going to use the default one, at least explicitly say they're using the default one.

A default context can be explicitly set using the -XfudgeContext parameter, e.g. -XfudgeContext=org.fudgemsg.FudgeContext.GLOBAL_DEFAULT, but users should be aware of the context and potential problems of using a default for anything more than trivial messages.

item.title: [PRO-5] Delete generated files as part of a "clean" job
item.description: The Ant task needs to identify files it has generated and delete them so it can be used as part of an "ant clean".
item.summary: Delete generated files as part of a "clean" job

comments.comment: This can be done just from Ant using PRO-19. The generated .gitignore files can be used to detect and delete automatically generated files. This technique can be used to other build tools like parser generators.
Excellent news!

item.title: [PRO-4] Fix build system so initial eclipse load is error free
item.summary: Fix build system so initial eclipse load is error free

comments.comment: Have checked out as a standalone project into a clean workspace and as part of the OG-Build without errors. If anyone still has initial errors, please reopen or e-mail me.

item.title: [PRO-3] Rewrite code generation to use some form of templating system
item.description:
Two options that seem well supported for this task:

  • StringTemplate (used by the Antlr guys for programming language generation to great success)
  • FreeMarker
item.summary: Rewrite code generation to use some form of templating system

item.title: [PRO-2] Document use of the Fudge Proto tools on the wiki
item.summary: Document use of the Fudge Proto tools on the wiki

comments.comment:
Basic operational notes are available at http://wiki.fudgemsg.org/display/FDG/Fudge+Proto but aren't publicly visible at the moment as the code isn't quite ready for consumption yet.

I'll keep these pages updated with any additional information as Pietari starts to use the tools more.
Documentation is publicly visible, along with the initial release on Github.

item.title: [PRO-1] Perform initial release of the Fudge-Proto distribution
item.summary: Perform initial release of the Fudge-Proto distribution

comments.comment: Published to FudgeMsg/Fuge-Proto on Github. Documentation and links on the Fudge wiki site.
